sources.name: Civil Transactions Law (Royal Decree No. M/191 of 2023)
Law of Procedure Before Sharia Courts

steps.title: Filing of Civil Claim
steps.description: Claimant files a civil claim electronically through the Najiz portal in accordance with civil and Sharia procedural law.

steps.title: Case Registration and Notification
steps.description: Court registers the case and notifies the defendant of the claim and hearing schedule.

steps.title: Exchange of Submissions and Evidence
steps.description: Parties submit pleadings, responses, and documentary evidence within timelines set by the court.

steps.title: Settlement or Reconciliation Consideration
steps.description: Court may encourage reconciliation or settlement between parties prior to adjudication.

conditional_branches.effect: Dispute resolved and settlement ratified by the court
Case proceeds to adjudication on merits

dependencies: Nature and value of civil claim
Clarity of contractual or transactional evidence
Compatibility of settlement with Sharia principles

failure_risks: Failure to comply with procedural deadlines
Disputes over Sharia compliance of claims

steps.title: Hearings and Evidence Review
steps.description: Court conducts hearings, reviews evidence, and hears submissions from the parties.

steps.title: Judgment
steps.description: Court issues judgment resolving the civil dispute in accordance with Sharia and statutory law.

steps.title: Appeal
steps.description: Aggrieved party may appeal the judgment before higher courts as permitted by law.

escalation_paths.condition: Appeal on points of law or Sharia compliance
